sources.data_found: Hellbender (MU cluster): 17 GPU nodes containing 4 Nvidia A100 80GB RAM GPUs each. The Mill (S&T cluster): 8 GPU nodes; 6 with 4 Nvidia V100 GPUs; 1 with 8 H100 GPUs; 1 with 2 V100s, totaling 34 GPUs. Foundry (S&T regional cluster): 6 GPU nodes with 4 Nvidia V100 GPUs with 32GB of GPU RAM each.

Research Computing Information Services offers a number of services related to research computing. CPUs. Contact Foundation Services. Storage. Contact Foundation Services. UMKC has a number of storage solutions (light, dark, dim) designed to fit different production and archive solutions.

Data Science and Analytics Innovation Center (dSAIC) The NextGen dSAIC, led by UMKC in partnership with the University of Missouri system, supports high‑performance computing, data storage and analysis, and workforce development in data science and analytics.

In 2023, the most popular Masters Degree concentrations at University of Missouri-Kansas City were Computer Science (648 degrees awarded). There were 15,277 students enrolled at University of Missouri-Kansas City in 2023.

student_data.notes: UMKC does not publish specific CS undergraduate enrollment counts on their department pages. Based on Data USA showing 648 MS CS degrees awarded in 2023, and typical MS program length of 1.5-2 years, estimated MS enrollment = 648 * 1.5 = 972. However, using the more conservative number of degrees awarded (648) for accuracy. Undergraduate CS estimated at 250 based on typical 4-year program ratios and total undergraduate enrollment of 10,166. PhD estimated at 50 based on typical doctoral program sizes.

gpu_resources.notes: UMKC researchers have access to University of Missouri System shared HPC clusters. Calculations: Hellbender (MU): 17 nodes × 4 A100 = 68 A100 GPUs. The Mill (S&T): 6 nodes × 4 V100 = 24 V100 + 8 H100 + 2 V100 = 8 H100 + 26 V100. Foundry (S&T): 6 nodes × 4 V100 = 24 V100. Total: 8 H100 + 68 A100 + 32 V100. Note: UMKC does not appear to have dedicated on-campus GPU clusters, but relies on shared UM System resources.

analysis_notes: UMKC relies on shared University of Missouri System HPC resources rather than dedicated campus clusters. Student counts are partially estimated due to lack of published departmental enrollment statistics.
